text:
<property name="host" value="foobar"/>
<telnet userid="public" 
     password="secret" 
     server=${host}> 
       <read>${host}%</read>   // Doesn't expand
</telnet> 

Currently, ${host} within the server attribute expands properly but expansion 
doesn't happend within read and write subtasks.  There doesn't seem to be 
suffiecient visibility to fix/workaround this problem without a code change.
creator: todd_evans@fanniemae.com
steve_l@iseran.com
text:
This bugrep puzzled me for a while, because it worked for me, but it clearly 
didnt work for you, but now I know what is going on here.

<telnet> expands properties passed in to the task as <read string> and <write 
string> attributes, but not when the strings are declared as nested text.

so <read string="${host}%"> would work.

I am leaving this open as I do think this is a bug we should fix

This is fixed in CVS, but I am not closing the bug until we are happy with the 
fix and backwards compatibility
creator: steve_l@iseran.com

text:
